Author: danw
Title: Relocating to the US, Part I (before you move)

Author: jsmcgd
Content: I think this is one of the main reasons that Lisp isn't popular; many in the community don't want it to be. This fact, along with sparse documentation and until recently, a lack of accessible editors have hampered growth. For a long time the only thing going for lisp seemed to be the language itself.

Author: chris_l
Content: I'll give you my own translation of Goethe: "sowing is not so hard as reaping"

Content: i would go for it. if it doesn't work out, then still, it will be a good experience. risks, i think is a part of entrepreneurship

Author: rms
Content: The American government is not competent enough to make use of higher taxes. I'd be delighted to live in a slightly socialist liberal democracy or a truly conservative society... unfortunately, America seems to get the worst of both sides of the political spectrum.
